title: WV Wesleyan 34, Urbana 7
text: Last updated on October 17, 2015 @ 10:16PM   10:13PM BUCKHANNON, W.Va.* -- West Virginia Wesleyan picked up its first win of the season by defeating Urbana, 34-7, on Saturday afternoon at Cebe Ross Field. The Bobcats (1-6, 1-6) did it on defense holding Urbana (2-5, 1-5) to just 149 yards of total offense, including just 56 on the ground. Kevin Pharon led the defensive effort with six tackles, including a pair of sacks for WVWC. Ryan Deal was 19-of-32 for 216 yards with three touchdowns and two interceptions. Michael Anderson had a big day on the ground with 27 carries for 168 yards. D'Gary Wallace had a strong effort for the Blue Knights on defense with 10 tackles (nine solo), with two tackles for a loss and one interception. Clayton Bullard and Curtis Galloway each contributed a pair of TFLs as well. Share
